items.title: Check F/R, brake, fuses, battery.
items.originalText:
### Related Information to Check Before Troubleshooting
1. **F/R Lever**: Ensure it is in the Neutral (N) position.
2. **Brake Pedal**: Confirm that the brake pedal is depressed.
3. **Fuses**: Check that the fuse or slow blow fuse is not broken. If broken, inspect the related wiring harness for ground faults.
4. **Battery Connection**: Verify that the battery cables are connected properly.

items.title: Check F/R lever, brake, fuses, battery.
items.originalText:
## Related Information 
Before proceeding with troubleshooting, ensure the following conditions are met:
- **F/R lever is in N (neutral) position.**
- **Brake pedal is depressed.**
- **Fuses (including slow blow fuses) are intact** (If broken, check the related wiring harness for ground faults).
- **Battery cable is connected** to the battery.

items.title: Defective battery specs.
items.originalText:
## Possible Causes and Standard Values
### 1. Defective Battery
- **Specific Gravity**: Minimum of 1.26
- **Voltage**: Minimum of 12 V

items.title: Manual organized by sections.
items.originalText: 2. **Structure of the Manual**: The manual is organized into various sections for ease of understanding.

items.title: Workshop service guide.
items.originalText: 1. **Purpose of the Manual**: This shop manual provides essential technical information for services performed in a workshop.

items.title: Check motor for defects.
items.originalText:
4. **Defective Starting Motor**
   - Prepare with the starting switch OFF and perform troubleshooting without turning the starting switch ON. 
   - Check the following resistances and voltages:
     - Between STARTING MOTOR (E) and ground: Maximum resistance of 1 â„¦.
     - Between STARTING MOTOR (B) and ground: Voltage should be between 10 and 15 V.
     - Between STARTING MOTOR (S) and ground: Voltage should be between 10 and 15 V.
   - If troubleshooting results are normal and the motor does not rotate, the starting motor is defective.

items.title: Safety first: secure vehicle.
items.originalText:
### Safety Information
- Always ensure that the vehicle is stationary and safely secured before performing any electrical diagnostics.
- Disconnect the battery before performing any wiring checks to avoid electrical shock or short-circuits.
